meta.title: Voxly Documentation - Open Source AI Language Tutor
meta.description: Official documentation for Voxly AI Language Tutor. Learn about the project, how to contribute, feature roadmap, and join our open source community.

hero.title: Voxly Documentation
hero.subtitle: Open Source AI Language Tutor - Building the future of language learning together
hero.tagline: Empowering language learners worldwide with conversational AI

about.title: About Voxly
about.content: Voxly is an innovative open-source AI language tutor designed to help learners practice conversational skills through interactive dialogue with an intelligent avatar. Our mission is to make language learning accessible, engaging, and effective for everyone.

features.title: Core Features
items: Real-time voice conversations with AI tutor
Multi-language support (Spanish, French, German, Chinese, Japanese, and more)
Privacy-first approach with local data handling

technology.title: Technology Stack
technology.description: Built with modern web technologies for performance and scalability

license.title: License
license.content: Voxly is released under the MIT License, making it free to use, modify, and distribute for both personal and commercial projects.

repository.title: Repository
repository.content: Our codebase is hosted on GitHub, where we welcome contributions from developers worldwide.

philosophy.title: Our Philosophy
philosophy.content: We believe in the power of community-driven development. By making Voxly open source, we aim to create a platform where developers, linguists, and educators can collaborate to create the best possible language learning experience.

contribute.title: How to Contribute
contribute.intro: We welcome contributions from developers of all skill levels. Whether you're a seasoned programmer or just starting out, there's a place for you in our community.

guidelines.title: Contribution Guidelines
guidelines.content: Please read our contribution guidelines before submitting any changes. We value code quality, clear documentation, and respectful communication.
